title: Doctor Who - Season 17 - (1979-80) - 26 Episodes
description:
PLEASE NOTE: Although my descriptions are not here to provide spoilers. someone complained I had. I obtain the description from Wikipedia and it did not dawn on me that I was spoiling it for others. I apologize if any of the descriptions spoil an episode for you. Having said that; 

SOAPBOX MODE ON:

     If you fear that my descriptions will ruin your viewing pleasure,
     DON'T READ THE DAMN THING!!! Just grab the freaking torrent and
     watch the bloody episodes!


SOAPBOX MODE OFF:

==============

The seventeenth season of British science fiction television series Doctor Who began on 1 September 1979 with the story Destiny of the Daleks, and ended with The Horns of Nimon. Tom Baker continued as the Fourth Doctor. Lalla Ward, who played Princess Astra in the season 16 finale The Armageddon Factor, returned to the series as the newly regenerated Romana, replacing Mary Tamm in the role. After John Leeson declined to voice K-9 in this season, David Brierley replaced him in the final three serials (and Shada). Davros returns in Destiny of the Daleks this time played by David Gooderson.

Season 17 was intended to follow the same format as had every season since Season 13, with five 4-part serials and a 6-parter closing the season out. However, the planned final serial of the season, Shada, was affected by an industrial dispute involving the BBC's technicians; while the location filming and the first studio recording session were completed, the strike meant that the planned second studio session had to be cancelled. Although the dispute was resolved and plans put in place to continue work on the story, it was eventually shelved, as the BBC was concerned its Christmas productions might be affected.

Episode List:

1.  Destiny of the Daleks - 4 Episodes

    Synopsis: The TARDIS lands the Fourth Doctor and Romana on a strangely
    familiar planet. There, they meet the android Movellans, who are locked
    in a war with the Daleks. The planet is Skaro, and in a bunker sits an
    enemy long thought dead Ã¢â‚¬â€ Davros, creator of the Daleks.

2.  City of Death - 4 Episodes

    Synopsis: The Doctor is enjoying a holiday in Paris with Romana when, armed
    with several Mona Lisa's, he uncovers an alien conspiracy that could result
    in the loss of all life on earth. 

3.  The Creature from the Pit - 4 Episodes

    Synopsis: On the planet Chloris, the Doctor, soon find themselves caught up
    in a long and secret enmity between the Lady Adrasta, who rules the planet
    in fear, and the mysterious Creature she keeps in a Pit.

4.  Nightmare of Eden - 4 Episodes

    Synopsis: The TARDIS lands at the site of a hyper-spatial collision between
    two spacecraft - as a result of which, neither ship is dimensionally stable,
    risking the lives of all those aboard.

5.  The Horns of Nimon - 4 Episodes

    Synopsis: After colliding with a spaceship, The Doctor, Romana and K-9 learn
    young natives from a peaceful planet called Aneth are being transported into
    a great labyrinth called "The Power Complex". 

6.  Shada - 6 Episodes

    Synopsis: The story revolves around the lost planet Shada, on which the Time
    Lords built a prison for defeated would-be conquerors of the universe. Skagra,
    an up-and-coming would-be conqueror of the universe, needs the assistance of
    one of the prison's inmates, but finds that nobody knows where Shada is
    anymore except one aged Time Lord who has retired to Earth.

    NOTE: Episode 6, Shada, was never televised. It only became available as part
          of The Legacy Box set. Nathan-Turner was eventually able to complete the
          story (so far as was possible) by commissioning new effects shots, a
          score and having Tom Baker record linking material to cover the missing
          scenes to create six shortened episodes of between 14 and 22 minutes
          each. The result was released on video in 1992.
